medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Absence seizures began at approximately 5 years of age; atonic seizures started during adolescence. In her mid-20s, the patient experienced frequent episodic tremors at rest, occasional ballistic movements, slowed speech, and progressive cognitive decline. Generalized tonicâ€“clonic seizures developed at age 28, increasing in frequency. By age 31, the patient had increasing myoclonic seizures and cognitive decline.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of migraine headaches, occasional shortness of breath, nausea, weight fluctuations, and depression that required hospitalization. Remote history of alcohol abuse. Childhood absence seizures and atonic seizures.
medical_history.family_history: Father had seizures beginning at 30 years and died at 48 years; four siblings had intractable epilepsy, dementia, and early death.
medical_history.social_history: Lived with long-term partner, taught art classes intermittently, and was currently receiving disability payments. Smoked cigarettes heavily for 15 years, drank alcohol rarely, and did not use illicit drugs.
